Subject: [DataLink] Error in numeric data from Excel
Description: Dear team, Please check the following issue in DataLink, which we believe is a bug.   Issue: DataLink cannot handle numeric fields during ingest. DataLink imports them as VARCHAR, and removes the decimal parts.   Case description / Steps to reproduce: -	Customer has an ?excel? file that is added to the ?Excel connector? in DataLink -	In this Excel file, one of the fields contains the price of the product. Here in Switzerland, numbers with decimals are written as ?22.80? with a ?dot? as the linker. -	During the import, DataLink removes the decimal parts, and adds only the INT part, as VARCHAR to the service. In the eg. : ?22? What we tested already: -	Manually replaced the ?.? with a ?,? in the excel file -	Defined the field as a ?number? in Excel -	Tested various Excel data types Findings: -	Only replacing the ?.? with a ?,? in the Excel file, finally had the ?22,80? value displayed in DataLink. -	This value in DataLink is now a VARCHAR, and it is not possible to cast it to something else -	To have the data shown correctly on the screen we had to replace the ?,? back to ?.? again in an SQL view (Select REPLACE(DL_H, ?,?,?.?) then cast it to a decimal number ?   Request: please check if this can be considered as a bug. If not, then please provide a guide on how price value ?22.80? can be used in DataLink without having to change the source data and modify it again later in DataLink.   Thank you Thomas
Resolution Reports:
[RESOLUTION REPORT] 
 Type of Resolution : Pending From Customer 
 Resolving as per our policy. As per comment from L4, there are two options to handle the issue: 
 1.Add Apostrophe (') to number so that it reads it as String. 
 2.Instead of above step you can just save file as .csv instead excel. As csv file supports every type.

Subject: [MagicInfo Server V9] Database problem after MagicInfo update
Description: GENERAL/REQUEST INFORMATION:	 * Problem Description:	 Yesterday, I updated a customer?s MagicInfo server from v7 to v9. After the update, we now have the problem that the server only works for a short while before becoming slower and slower until it does not load at all anymore, throwing ?Internal server error? messages.   At first, the update (to 21.1020.0) went through fine, but it did not install the MagicInfo service after completion. Consulting the logs showed that there seemed to have been a handle on the tomcat directory that blocked the rename attempt when using the installer?s check. The installer noted ?FAIL? for accessibility of the tomcat directory, but still gave an end result of ?PASS?. Accessing the contents of the tomcat folder seemed to cause no problems (?PASS? on service.bat). So, contents were updated during the update, but after looking at the service.bat I noticed that tomcat 9 was missing, only tomcat 8 was present. I proceeded to copy the tomcat9 executable from the newly created tomcat9x64 folder (iirc) to the tomcat folder and reinstalled the service myself.   After that, the server was up, but I decided to be safe and double check that no handles are open on the tomcat folder before doing another upgrade (to 21.1030.0). This went through fine, but now I have the problem that database connections do not seem to be closed anymore. When the server is newly started, it behaves normally, but after a few actions it starts to become very slow before becoming nonfunctional. Looking through the logs, I notice the following:   [2023-02-07 17:28:04] ERROR [com.samsung.magicinfo.protocol.http.client.WSReverseClientServlet.doGet(WSReverseClientServlet.java:424)] -   java.sql.SQLTransientConnectionException: HikariPool-1 - Connection is not available, request timed out after 5000ms.   When checking the server once this state is reached, I see that there are many Postgres processes running that do not reduce in number over time. Therefore, I assume that the database does not correctly close connections after a query has finished, thus running into the connection limit and refusing any further connections. The database in question is a Postgres 9.3 instance, administrated through PGAdmin III. Additionally, I see a lot of CIFS-related errors that might be due the customer using a LOT of CIFS folders ? of which not all might be available still. The server in question is nearly 11 years old, it is therefore possible that there are quite a few leftovers that have never been checked.   The logs as well as the tail end of the wsrm.log pertaining to this issue are attached.
